newsitem.title: RUSSIA: LUKoil, Algerian Sonatrach in Algerian energy deal.
newsitem.headline: LUKoil, Algerian Sonatrach in Algerian energy deal.

text.p: Russia's LUKoil and Algerian state-owned energy company Sonatrach signed a protocol of intent on Wednesday to tap Algerian hydrocarbon reserves, a LUKoil statement said.
It gave few details, saying only that the two sides would cooperate on a production-sharing basis.
LUKoil President Vagit Alekperov said in the release that the deal signalled the return of Russia's largest crude oil producer to Mediterranean markets.
No details were provided on which fields the two sides would develop, over what period or at what cost.
LUKoil's strategic partner is the Atlantic Richfield Co (ARCO) of the United States, which owns about an eight percent stake.
ARCO has an agreement with Sonatrach to quintuple production in an enhanced oil recovery project at Algeria's three billion barrel Rhourde el Baguel field.
LUKoil and ARCO have an agreement to spend $3 billion on joint projects in Russia and overseas, with most of the financing to come from ARCO.
LUKoil is also cooperating with Agip SpA of Italy in both Russia and North Africa.
